SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
MARKETING CLOUD GROWTH
Considerations and Limitations for Forms on Marketing Cloud Growth Landing Pages

When you’re working with a form on a landing page, keep these considerations and limitations in mind.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Marketing Cloud Growth Edition


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create or edit content:	

Marketing Cloud Manager permission set

AND

any CMS workspace contributor role


To publish or unpublish content:	

Marketing Cloud Manager permission set

AND

a CMS workspace contributor role of content admin or content manager

Considerations
Landing pages can be created without a form.
A form must have at least one button and one input element.
Don’t add duplicates of the same data source field to a form.
Don’t change the API Name value of a field added from a data source.
When there’s more than one version of a form, the landing page’s form dropdown contains only the latest published version of the form.
When you edit a form, you must create a new flow version to go with it. If you add, remove, or change fields on your form, also make sure the updated fields are mapped properly.
If you add a supported data source field to your form, and the field type changes to an unsupported type, the changed field disappears from the Fields list. However, the field isn’t removed from the form. Manually remove the unsupported field from the form.
Unpublishing a landing page doesn’t affect its related form. If needed, unpublish the form and deactivate its related flow.
In orgs with duplicate rules, the flow related to a form doesn’t create a lead, contact, or person account record if the information submitted by the form matches an existing record.
To add an image that’s hosted outside of Marketing Cloud Growth to a landing page, you must allowlist the domain that hosts the image using the Content Security Policy (CSP) directives in Trusted URLs in Setup. See Manage Trusted URLs.
Limitations
Only one form can be added to a landing page.
A form can be related to only one flow.
A form can't be embedded on an external website.
When a flow is automatically generated from a form, the flow isn’t automatically related to a campaign. You must manually relate the flow to a campaign before the flow can be activated.
You can change the field type of a custom field referenced on a form only if the form supports the new field type.
Before a landing page can be published, its form must have a flow related to it.
When a form is built with Salesforce object fields from a data source, the fields inherit the language of the person building the form, not the language associated with the workspace.
To capture form submission data, these fields must have specific unique name values.
Email address fields must have the unique name “Email”.
First name fields must have the unique name “FirstName”.
Last name fields must have the unique name “LastName”.

Capitalization doesn’t matter as long as the right letters are there without any extra characters. For example, an email address field with the unique name of “email”, “Email”, or “EmAiL” appears on a web engagement report. An email address field with the unique name “Email123” doesn’t.

SEE ALSO

Unpublish a Form in Marketing Cloud Growth

title: Considerations and Limitations for Forms on Marketing Cloud Growth Landing Pages
